segment.source: How to Upgrade an Existing Virtual Application
segment.target: How to Upgrade an Existing Virtual Application

segment.source: How to Upgrade an Existing Virtual Application
segment.target: How to Upgrade an Existing Virtual Application

segment.source: How to Upgrade an Existing Virtual Application
segment.target: How to Upgrade an Existing Virtual Application

segment.source: You can upgrade an existing virtual application to a new version by using the Application Virtualization (App-V) Sequencer.
segment.target: You can upgrade an existing virtual application to a new version by using the Application Virtualization (App-V) Sequencer.

segment.source: The upgrade process is similar to creating a new virtual application.
segment.target: The upgrade process is similar to creating a new virtual application.

segment.source: You must open the existing virtual application for an upgrade, make the necessary updates, and then save the updated virtual application to a new location in the package root directory.
segment.target: You must open the existing virtual application for an upgrade, make the necessary updates, and then save the updated virtual application to a new location in the package root directory.

segment.source: You can also use the App-V Sequencer Console to make changes to an existing virtual application without performing an upgrade.
segment.target: You can also use the App-V Sequencer Console to make changes to an existing virtual application without performing an upgrade.

segment.source: However, you cannot make modifications to the virtual application’s file system by using this method because the App-V Sequencer does not actually decode the associated .sft file.
segment.target: However, you cannot make modifications to the virtual application’s file system by using this method because the App-V Sequencer does not actually decode the associated .sft file.

segment.source: For example; you can open an existing virtual application in the App-V Sequencer Console by selecting Open on the File menu.
segment.target: For example; you can open an existing virtual application in the App-V Sequencer Console by selecting Open on the File menu.

segment.source: You can update the Package Name and the associated Comments, and you can make changes to the virtual file system and virtual registry.
segment.target: You can update the Package Name and the associated Comments, and you can make changes to the virtual file system and virtual registry.

segment.source: You can also create a Windows Installer file.
segment.target: You can also create a Windows Installer file.

segment.source: Use the following procedure to upgrade an existing virtual application.
segment.target: Use the following procedure to upgrade an existing virtual application.

segment.source: To upgrade an existing virtual application
segment.target: To upgrade an existing virtual application

segment.source: To start the App-V Sequencer Console, on the computer running the App-V Sequencer, select StartProgramsMicrosoft Application VirtualizationMicrosoft Application Virtualization Sequencer.
segment.target: To start the App-V Sequencer Console, on the computer running the App-V Sequencer, select StartProgramsMicrosoft Application VirtualizationMicrosoft Application Virtualization Sequencer.

segment.source: To open the existing virtual application, in the App-V Console, select FileOpen for Package Upgrade.
segment.target: To open the existing virtual application, in the App-V Console, select FileOpen for Package Upgrade.

segment.source: Use the Open For Package Upgrade dialog box to locate the associated SPRJ file you want to open for upgrade.
segment.target: Use the Open For Package Upgrade dialog box to locate the associated SPRJ file you want to open for upgrade.

segment.source: To specify the location of where the package will be decoded, click Browse For Folder and specify the Q:.
segment.target: To specify the location of where the package will be decoded, click Browse For Folder and specify the Q:.

segment.source: This is the location where the package root directory will be created as specified in the associated SFT file.
segment.target: This is the location where the package root directory will be created as specified in the associated SFT file.

segment.source: When you create the updated version of the package, it will be denoted with a sequential addition to the directory name—for example, “.1” will be added to the directory name located on the Q: drive.
segment.target: When you create the updated version of the package, it will be denoted with a sequential addition to the directory name—for example, “.1” will be added to the directory name located on the Q: drive.

segment.source: To open the Sequencing Wizard, select ToolsSequencing Wizard.
segment.target: To open the Sequencing Wizard, select ToolsSequencing Wizard.

segment.source: On the Package Information page, optionally specify the new Package Name and add optional comments that will be associated with the updated virtual application.
segment.target: On the Package Information page, optionally specify the new Package Name and add optional comments that will be associated with the updated virtual application.

segment.source: Click Next.
segment.target: Click Next.

segment.source: On the Monitor Installation page, to begin monitoring the new installation, click Begin Monitoring.
segment.target: On the Monitor Installation page, to begin monitoring the new installation, click Begin Monitoring.

segment.source: After the virtual environment has finished loading, install the updated version of the application, or apply updates to the existing application.
segment.target: After the virtual environment has finished loading, install the updated version of the application, or apply updates to the existing application.

segment.source: After you have finished updating the virtual application, click Stop Monitoring, and then click Next.
segment.target: After you have finished updating the virtual application, click Stop Monitoring, and then click Next.

segment.source: On the Additional Files to Map to Virtual File System (VFS) page, to specify additional files to be added to the Virtual File System (VFS), click Add.
segment.target: On the Additional Files to Map to Virtual File System (VFS) page, to specify additional files to be added to the Virtual File System (VFS), click Add.

segment.source: Browse to the file you want to add, and click Open.
segment.target: Browse to the file you want to add, and click Open.

segment.source: To clear existing files that have been added, click Reset, and then click Next.
segment.target: To clear existing files that have been added, click Reset, and then click Next.

segment.source: On the Configure Applications page, configure the shortcuts and file type associations that will be associated with the updated virtual application.
segment.target: On the Configure Applications page, configure the shortcuts and file type associations that will be associated with the updated virtual application.

segment.source: Select the element you want to update, and then click Edit Locations.
segment.target: Select the element you want to update, and then click Edit Locations.

segment.source: Specify the configurations in the Shortcut Locations dialog box, and then click Next.
segment.target: Specify the configurations in the Shortcut Locations dialog box, and then click Next.

segment.source: On the Launch Applications page, to start the application to ensure that the package is optimized for streaming, select the package and click Launch.
segment.target: On the Launch Applications page, to start the application to ensure that the package is optimized for streaming, select the package and click Launch.

segment.source: This step is useful for configuring how the application initially runs on target computers and for accepting any associated license agreements before the package is made available to clients.
segment.target: This step is useful for configuring how the application initially runs on target computers and for accepting any associated license agreements before the package is made available to clients.

segment.source: If there are multiple applications associated with this package, you can select Launch All to open all of the applications.
segment.target: If there are multiple applications associated with this package, you can select Launch All to open all of the applications.

segment.source: To sequence the new version of the virtual application, click Next.
segment.target: To sequence the new version of the virtual application, click Next.

segment.source: To finish and to close the Sequencing Wizard, on the Sequence Package page, click Finish.
segment.target: To finish and to close the Sequencing Wizard, on the Sequence Package page, click Finish.

segment.source: After you have successfully updated the virtual application, to save the package, in the App-V Sequencer Console, on the File menu, select Save.
segment.target: After you have successfully updated the virtual application, to save the package, in the App-V Sequencer Console, on the File menu, select Save.

segment.source: The virtual application can be accessed in the directory specified in step 3.
segment.target: The virtual application can be accessed in the directory specified in step 3.

segment.target: Related topics

segment.target: Application Virtualization Sequencer
